French: Il n'est pas digne de toi.
Je ne dispose pas d'une arme.

English: I felt a drop of rain.
What do you think of his suggestion?
I don't particularly want to do it.
French: Je ne veux pas {{c::particulièrement}} le faire.

English: Do you think i want to die?

French: C'est la partie que je n'aime pas.
Je ne céderai pas d'un pouce.

English: How much money do you have?
How many apples do you want?
I love you, he {{c::whispered}} into her ear.

French: Il est à {{c::l'article}} de la mort.

English: How much money do you have?

French: Je prendrai une coupe de champagne.

English: I'll take a glass of champagne.
I was looking for a pair of {{c::scissors}}.
French: Je cherchais une paire de ciseaux.

English: I was looking for a pair of scissors.
He is thick as a brick.
This is the truth, i {{c::assure}} you!
French: C'est la vérité, je vous assure !

English: I saw him cross the road.

French: Je le vis traverser la route.

English: I saw him crossing the road.
I saw him cross the street.

French: Je ne suis certainement pas le seul.

English: I'm certainly not the only one.
French: Je ne suis {{c::certainement}} pas le seul.
Ils ne vendent pas de recharges.

English: I'll come as soon as possible.
What do you want to talk to me about?
I've got a touch of the {{c::flu}}.
There's a gap in my memory.

French: Je ne m'attendais pas à ce résultat.
Je ne m’attendais pas à ce résultat.

English: I know that better than anybody.

French: Le cheval est à la ferme.
Il le frappa à la tête.
